tournament.name: Tournoi de la rentrée à Libourne [30 HP]

decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of land destruction, extra turn spells, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by destroying their lands with cards like Wildfire and Jokulhaups, while also ramping up its own mana with spells like Kodama's Reach and Cultivate. The extra turn spells and planeswalkers provide card advantage and constant threats to overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of board wipes, mana acceleration, and powerful creatures like Inferno Titan and Sylvan Primordial, the deck aims to control the game until it can establish a dominant position and win through overwhelming force.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering and delaying opponent's spells while using Narset's ability to quickly cast powerful spells for free. It includes a variety of counterspells, card draw, and removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck also includes extra turn spells like Temporal Manipulation and Time Warp to gain additional advantage and put pressure on the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three colors and enable casting Narset and other spells efficiently. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to establish control over the game, prevent the opponent from executing their strategy, and win through powerful spells and extra turns.

The deck revolves around using Narset, Enlightened Master as the commander to control the game through a combination of powerful spells and counters. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes a variety of lands that provide colored mana as well as utility. The deck includes a wide range of powerful control spells, from counterspells like Force of Will and Cryptic Command to board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Wrath of God. Card draw and card selection spells like Brainstorm and Fact or Fiction help ensure the player has the right answers at the right time. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's plans and establish control of the game, ultimately winning through Narset's powerful abilities and game-ending spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to out-value and outpace the opponent. Vendilion Clique serves as both a disruptive threat and a way to control the opponent's draws. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Oblivion Stone and Vedalken Shackles while also being able to transform its own threats into game-winning bombs with cards like Proteus Staff and Polymorph. The deck's win condition revolves around powerful finishers like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while using cards like Tunnel Vision to set up game-winning combos. The deck is designed to dismantle the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition.

The focus of this deck is to utilize Karador, Ghost Chieftain as the commander to recur creatures from the graveyard and assemble various combos for a win condition. The deck includes a variety of creatures with useful abilities and enters-the-battlefield effects, along with key combo pieces like Boonweaver Giant and Pattern of Rebirth. It also features a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for with cards like Birthing Pod and Survival of the Fittest. The deck aims to control the board with disruption creatures like Gaddock Teeg and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, while also being able to generate value through cards like Liliana of the Veil and Sylvan Library.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a wide array of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of permission spells like Force of Will, Counterspell, and Mana Leak, along with versatile cards like Cryptic Command and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck aims to maintain board control and dictate the pace of the game. Additionally, the deck includes powerful tutor effects like Demonic Tutor and Grim Tutor to find key combo pieces like Splinter Twin and Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker to close out the game efficiently. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors and support the deck's control strategy effectively.

The deck revolves around utilizing The Gitrog Monster's abilities to create a powerful combo engine. The main strategy involves using lands to draw cards and generate mana, while also utilizing discard and sacrifice effects to gain advantage over the opponent. The deck includes powerful ramp cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Exploration, as well as a range of removal and disruption spells to control the board. Additionally, the deck includes key cards like Life from the Loam and Sylvan Library to ensure card advantage and consistency. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of card advantage and powerful spells.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively ramp up mana using cards like Utopia Sprawl, Wild Growth, and Fyndhorn Elves to cast powerful creatures quickly. Xenagos, God of Revels serves as the commander, providing haste and a power boost to your creatures, allowing you to deal massive amounts of damage to your opponent. The deck includes various efficient threats like Primeval Titan, Pathbreaker Ibex, and Inferno Titan to quickly end the game. Additionally, cards like Arlinn Kord and Domri Rade provide additional support and removal options to maintain board control. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with big threats and swift attacks before they can stabilize.
